posts.post_content: Akroma is indeed easy to take out. My friend and I were playing each other with our W decks just for the hell of it, and he tossed out Akroma and went for my throat. I defended with [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) and turned his smirk and shrug into a barely concealed rage when I used [Righteousness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Righteousness) to turn my angel into an 11/11. Regardless, Akroma's 6/6 with all of those abilities are quite nice. Of course she's going to be targeted, especially by blue decks which she has no defense against. If she is targeted, fine, the blue opponent I'm playing against just used a counter on my 6/6 Akroma and now I get to use [Armored Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armored Ascension) or equip [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak)s on whatever card I like. Anyway, my point is that just because a card is a target does not mean it does not have a place in a deck. As far as I am concerned, Akroma fills my deck as a red herring so my opponents get scared about the wrong thing. 4.5/5 due to the weaknes... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Akroma is indeed easy to take out. My friend and I were playing each other with our W decks just for the hell of it, and he tossed out Akroma and went for my throat. I defended with Serra Angel and turned his smirk and shrug into a barely concealed rage when I used Righteousness to turn my angel into an 11/11. Regardless, Akroma's 6/6 with all of those abilities are quite nice. Of course she's going to be targeted, especially by blue decks which she has no defense against. If she is targeted, fine, the blue opponent I'm playing against just used a counter on my 6/6 Akroma and now I get to use Armored Ascension or equip Whispersilk Cloaks on whatever card I like. Anyway, my point is that just because a card is a target does not mean it does not have a place in a deck. As far as I am concerned, Akroma fills my deck as a red herring so my opponents get scared about the wrong thing. 4.5/5 due to the weaknes... (see all)

posts.post_content: What's more of a comedy sketch is an opponent's face when staring down at the 6/6 vigilant attacker on turn four, or perhaps turn two, thanks to a discard and reanimation. When played properly, she wins far more games than otherwise, and as for most artifact and enchantment issues, simply properly playing white should protect her from everything this side of [pacifism](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pacifism)[icy manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=icy manipulator). Oh, and [condemn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=condemn)? I'll [rebuff the wicked](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rebuff the wicked). Or just be UW and counter it.
posts.html:
What's more of a comedy sketch is an opponent's face when staring down at the 6/6 vigilant attacker on turn four, or perhaps turn two, thanks to a discard and reanimation. When played properly, she wins far more games than otherwise, and as for most artifact and enchantment issues, simply properly playing white should protect her from everything this side of pacifismicy manipulator. Oh, and condemn? I'll rebuff the wicked. Or just be UW and counter it.

posts.post_content: The black deck has [Reiver Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiver Demon) and cards that force your opponent to sacrifice creatures such as [Barter in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barter in Blood), and [Abyssal Gatekeeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abyssal Gatekeeper).

Posted By: redhaiku (4/5/2009 6:12:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When I got this card, I'd almost assume it were a gamewinner... but after playing with her in my mono-white deck for a few months, I've only used her once to pull off victory. Useually she becomes nothing more then a powerful blocker to prevent my opponent from attacking me with flying creatures.
  
   
Victory normally comes from either Armored Ascension, or a well placed attack with my balloonist... granting flying to a powerful creature without.
  
   
I've even considered taking her out of my deck to replace with a soldier card, since I play a mostly soldier deck.
posts.html:

Victory normally comes from either Armored Ascension, or a well placed attack with my balloonist... granting flying to a powerful creature without.

I've even considered taking her out of my deck to replace with a soldier card, since I play a mostly soldier deck.

Posted By: Man-in-the-Hat (9/25/2009 10:01:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's almost a comedy sketch, the number of ways in which Akroma hardly ever actually wins a game... be it [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell), [Icy Manipulator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Icy Manipulator), [Wing Snare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wing Snare), [Hurricane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurricane) or just a really big blocker, she seems to have this amazing talent for never actually working against W, U, G or artifacts, no matter what deck she's in or who's piloting her. I'd almost feel sorry for her, if she wasn't such an irritating cow in the Otaria series.
posts.html:
It's almost a comedy sketch, the number of ways in which Akroma hardly ever actually wins a game... be it Swords to Plowshares, Counterspell, Icy Manipulator, Wing Snare, Hurricane or just a really big blocker, she seems to have this amazing talent for never actually working against W, U, G or artifacts, no matter what deck she's in or who's piloting her. I'd almost feel sorry for her, if she wasn't such an irritating cow in the Otaria series.
